prompt.promptText: At the MOST RECENT signal, how much were you worrying?
At the MOST RECENT signal, how hard was it to control your worry?
How many minutes ago did this worry episode begin?
What is the worry about? Check all that apply.
In one sentence, please write out your worried thought WHEN YOU WERE SIGNALED.
If the outcome you are worried about were to happen, how negative would it be for you?
At the MOST RECENT signal, how hard was it to control your thoughts?
When did thoughts about the current topic begin?
What is the thought about? Check all that apply.
In one sentence, please write out your thought WHEN YOU WERE SIGNALED.
How positive or negative is this thought?
At the MOST RECENT signal, how much were you worrying?
At the MOST RECENT signal, how hard was it to control your worry?
Are you thinking about the same topic as when you were last signaled?
What is the worry about? Check all that apply.
In one sentence, please write out your worried thought WHEN YOU WERE SIGNALED.
When did you worried thoughts end?
What contributed to ending the worry? - I arrived at a solution
I made a mental plan to improve the situation.
I took action to improve the situation.
I talked to someone about my worry.
I distracted myself by thinking about something else.
I distracted myself with projects, chores, or work.
I distracted myself with an enjoyable activity.
I sought out other people to take my mind off my worry.
There was nothing more I could do to improve the situation.
The situation resolved itself.
Something else contributed to ending the worry (please specify):
After you stopped worrying, to what extent did additional worried thoughts intrude into your mind?
Thinking back, how would you rate the intensity of this worry episode?
To what extent did the worry interfere with other things youâ€™d rather focus on?
At the MOST RECENT signal, how much were you worrying?
At the MOST RECENT signal, how hard was it to control your worry?
Are you thinking about the same topic as when you were last signaled?
What is the worry about? Check all that apply.
In one sentence, please write out your worried thought WHEN YOU WERE SIGNALED.
What is contributing to the return of worry? I keep trying to think of other or better ways to achieve a desired outcome.
I keep trying to think of other or better ways to prevent a negative outcome.
I am trying to stop worrying, but I can't seem to stop.
I am doing things that remind me of the worry.
My negative mood keeps me thinking about the worry.
I am thinking about all the ways the situation could turn out badly.
I am remembering situations in the past that have turned out badly.
I believe a negative outcome is likely.
I believe a negative outcome would have a large, longâ€term impact on my life.
I believe that worrying now will benefit me in the future.
I am worried that so much worry could be bad for me.
I am unsure if I can handle this situation successfully.
